Antique Mahogany George III Glazed Cabinet Bookcase Secretaire with an arrangement of pigeon hoes and oak lined drawers veneered in satinwood with turned brass knobs. The Bookcase has the original glass doors and 2 shelves and the original brass lock.   Exceptional craftsmanship to the Cornice with detailed decorative carvings .   The Bookcase sits firmly on the base of the secretaire and will be removed and wrapped separately for delivery to ensure safety in carriage and placement in the home.

The Secretaire is in lovely condition and excellent quality.   It has a beautiful rich tone and grain to the mahogany and decorative brass latch handles to the drawers, and desk supports.  We believe these to be a later addition having been replaced at some time in the past.    The Bureau has a pull down desk ledge which is supported by solid mahogany retractable supports on each side of the chest to create a sturdy desk to work at.   The desk ledge has the original leather top which is worn in parts as one would expect having regard to the age of the piece however it adds to the authenticity and importantly in original condition with no restoration. The hinges have been replaced likely many years ago but the repair/replacements are sturdy and solid Most of the pull out pigeon drawers for storage of smaller items have the original brass handles and some have been replaced some time in the past.

The main drawers are solid and sturdy and have well constructed casings and the drawers run nicely as one would expect from such a quality piece.  

This is a beautiful example of  the hand craftsmanship of the period.

Dimensions

H 218 x W 122 x D 57 cm

Desk Ledge - H 81 x W 106 x D 65 cm

The frame whilst in excellent condition has some marks here and there but none that affect the overall condition and having regard to the decorative detail are disguised on only noticeable on close inspection.

The mirror fits to the frame with brass supports at the back.   Due to the heavy weight of the mirror and its frame the mirror is fixed in one position as shown in the images and should be left in this position.  Atttempts to tilt the mirror and over turn the fixings to hold it in place, the weight of the mirror and its heavy frame would be too much pressure to fix  in position and would lead to the frame splitting.     The mirror is securely fixed in its current position and has no stability issues.

An excellent example displaying expert craftsmanship and quality design of the period.

artwork-collectibles.Name: Mid Century Lee Burr Reynolds Christie’s Oil Acrylic Mixed Media  Painting /2238
artwork-collectibles.Body:
Original Lee Burr Reynolds large multi media oil and acrylic painting on stretched canvas titled 'Musicale'.  Exhibited in the East Park Galllery in New York by Christies.   A large and striking painting in multi tones of blue, peach, coral, black featuring sections of sheet music and described as 'a painting of the highest merit’ Signed in the bottom corner.   East Park Gallery Stamp to the back canvas along with the Christies bio of the painting and original tag.


Lee Burr was born in LA in 1936 and graduated with a Bachelors degree in Fine Art from the University of Southern California in 1962.  His richly surfaced abstracts of massive scale are exhibited in well known museums in the USA and Major Art Collections in Europe of the Avante-Garde


While it’s estimated there were more than half a million Lee Reynolds paintings created, Burr has only painted around 350 original canvases of his own in his lifetime with precious few, if any, ever available for sale by Vanguard


Dimensions H 123 x W 153 cm


To ensure this painting reaches the buyer in the condition it left us delivery is by Independent Professional Courier within 7 to 14 business days but very often sooner.  Delivery to most UK postcodes for £35 or collection in person by courier or buyer.

artwork-collectibles.Body:
Original Mid Century Vintage Framed Lithograph Signed Print by Antoni Clave titled 'King Bacchus' 1959.

Antoni Clave was one of Spain's best known and most celebrated artists.   His work evolved from a baroque, ornamental style to a pure, minimal aesthetic.   In his later years, his work was abstract, employing expressive lines and exploring the boudaries of collage, objet trove, shading, texture and colour.   

This is an original Lithograph limited edition from the 1960's and is not a modern reproduction print.  Purchased alongside a number of other pieces from the estate of a Collector of Modern Art.   Please see our other items for sale.

The lithograph is in perfect condition with no damage or fading.  

Dimensions

mid-century-vintage-original-sideboards-.Name: Rare John & Sylvia Reid Vintage Mid Century  Rosewood Sideboard Credenza /2240
mid-century-vintage-original-sideboards-.Body:
Rare 1960’s Rosewood Palisander Mid Century Vintage Sideboard believed to be a commission piece designed by John and Sylvia Reid in the 1960’s. Whilst sharing some of the design features of the C Range which was also designed by J & S Reid for Stag,  tthe shape and design of the integrated handle pulls are entirely reminiscent of the C Range however the quality of the pallisander rosewood and the exceptional detail to the cabinetry clearly sets the piece.  Furthermore the sideboard was purchased from an immaculate 1960's  Architect Design Home together with a number of other items including a Bedroom Set from the C Range and also other high end design pieces from the era.  There is no provenance provided however the quality of the furniture in the home is a clear indication. 

The edges to the main frame of the sideboard have hand crafted exposed dovetail joints in a deeper tone and immediately draw the eye to the detail.  

Whilst a neat and compact size the storage capacity is spacious with 3 deep graduating drawers which all run beauttfully.  The cupboards are separated with a vertical divider and split door, the left side has 2 shelves one of which is recessed to enable storage of taller items, the right hand side cupboard has a drawer tray and designed with storage of cutlery.

Exceptional vintage condition with a lovely tone and grain and from a smoke and pet free home.  The sideboard has been fully cleaned and lightly polished and is in original condition.   There is no damage or repairs to note.   The quality and appearance of the match grain is spectacular.   The top has no damage or deep scratches however there is some light shading due to sunlight over time which is entirely usual with vintage furniture and particularly so with darker tone woods.   This should not concern the buyer and as the sideboard is viewed from the front with items positioned on the top for display it will go unnoticed.

sold-items-1.Name: Pair Midcentury G Plan Fresco Vintage Teak  Bedside Cabinets With Drawers /2258
sold-items-1.Body:
Pair Mid Century G Plan Fresco Vintage Teak Bedside Chests  with one drawer and open storage for books, magazines etc. Original integrated signature Fresco handle pulls to the drawers which are dovetailed and G Plan Makers Label present. The drawers run smoothly as they should and have solid casings.   

Lovely match grain and rich tone to the teak and both in excellent condition.   The Chests are a true pair however one is slightly lighter to the front of the  drawer which is due to more exposure to sunlight over the years which is common of teak items of the era. This should not deter the buyer as the cabinets will be positioned either side of the bed and slight difference in shade will not be noticed.



Dimensions

H 54 x W 45.5 x D 40.5 cm

Drawers - H 8.5 x W 39.5 cm


Nationwide delivery by professional and reliable couriers with delivery stated to be 7 to 14 working days but usually sooner.  Delivery is for ground floor doorstep delivery only.   The chests will be wrapped for carriage.  Please message with postcode for firm quote.

Once dispatched buyer details will be passed to the courier to arrange a mutually convenient date and time for delivery.  Central London deliveries weekly £55 - Manchester/Liverpool/Leeds/Newcastle/Birmingham/Bristol/Nottingham £45.    Scotland and South Coast fortnightly depending on courier routes.
